script.name: plugin.piracy.scanner
script.description: Piracy: Pirate Scanner: Long range versatile cargo scanner

comment.var: PIRATE SCANNER --by-- MISTER BEAR v1.60 Jan-2011
Lists and analyses civilian and commercial vessels in the sector
Load previous Display Mode and Sort Order

line.text: add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu info line to array

line.comment: *add custom menu info line to array $aMenu: text=$szOutput
*add custom menu info line to array $aMenu: text=$szOutput

comment.var: GET LIST of ALL ships in the sector
CREATE PARALLEL ARRAY TO SORT SHIPS WITH (re-uses 'aListItem')
REMOVE INAPPROPRIATE SHIPS BASED ON THE DISPLAY MODE
Sort by LASER STRENGTH (then by distance)
Sort by SHIELD STRENGTH (then by distance)
Sort by CARGO VALUE in reverse (then by distance) [REQ: aTemp and aWares]
COMMERCIAL: Doesn't display object class or passenger count
CIVILIAN: Don't display object class or laser power
POLICE: Don't display passenger count or cargo value

line.text: add custom menu heading to array

comment.var: COLOURING: RED:Foe, CYAN:Cargo Shields, BLUE:Illegal Goods, YELLOW:Fighters, ORANGE:Escorts, WHITE:Target, NONE:Default

line.text: add custom menu item to array
add custom menu item to array
add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu heading to array

comment.var: Choose Sort By mode - "Order Results by"

line.text: add custom menu item to array
add custom menu heading to array

comment.var: Close dialog - "Close Sector Traffic Analysis Interface"

line.text: add custom menu item to array

comment.var: Title and Description - "Sector Traffic Analysis" / "Developed by BearCorp"
SAVE DISPLAY MODE and SORT ORDER
EXIT, DISPLAY DETAILS or REFRESH DATA
SHOULD DISPLAY SHIP : Determine whether a ship should be displayed based on current display mode
Skip check if it's a pirate ship (never display pirates vessels)
Skip civilian vessels while in police and commercial mode
Don't bother testing M1s and M2s either, assume they're police
GET ESCORT LEADER: If ship is part of a convoy, retrieve the leading ship
CALCULATE ENTIRE CARGO VALUE : Calculate the total value of tradeable wares, un-installed equipment and passengers/personnel
PARAM : oShip -- ship who's cargo is to be valued

sval.val: Piracy: Pirate Scanner: Long range versatile cargo scanner
PIRATE SCANNER --by-- MISTER BEAR v1.60 Jan-2011
Lists and analyses civilian and commercial vessels in the sector
Load previous Display Mode and Sort Order
GET LIST of ALL ships in the sector
CREATE PARALLEL ARRAY TO SORT SHIPS WITH (re-uses 'aListItem')
REMOVE INAPPROPRIATE SHIPS BASED ON THE DISPLAY MODE
Sort by LASER STRENGTH (then by distance)
Sort by SHIELD STRENGTH (then by distance)
Sort by CARGO VALUE in reverse (then by distance) [REQ: aTemp and aWares]
COMMERCIAL: Doesn't display object class or passenger count
CIVILIAN: Don't display object class or laser power
POLICE: Don't display passenger count or cargo value
COLOURING: RED:Foe, CYAN:Cargo Shields, BLUE:Illegal Goods, YELLOW:Fighters, ORANGE:Escorts, WHITE:Target, NONE:Default
Choose Sort By mode - "Order Results by"
Close dialog - "Close Sector Traffic Analysis Interface"
Title and Description - "Sector Traffic Analysis" / "Developed by BearCorp"
SAVE DISPLAY MODE and SORT ORDER
EXIT, DISPLAY DETAILS or REFRESH DATA
SHOULD DISPLAY SHIP : Determine whether a ship should be displayed based on current display mode
Skip check if it's a pirate ship (never display pirates vessels)
Skip civilian vessels while in police and commercial mode
Don't bother testing M1s and M2s either, assume they're police
GET ESCORT LEADER: If ship is part of a convoy, retrieve the leading ship
CALCULATE ENTIRE CARGO VALUE : Calculate the total value of tradeable wares, un-installed equipment and passengers/personnel
PARAM : oShip -- ship who's cargo is to be valued
